screen_desc: The screenshot shows the Best Buy website on a mobile device. It features a product recommendation section, highlighting a gaming keyboard (Corsair K70 RGB PRO) and other products like tablets and smartphones. There's a prompt asking if the user is still interested in the previously viewed item. The site navigation bar includes links for searching, viewing deals, and checking the shopping cart. The page also displays a "Black Friday Deals" banner.
action_think: The user request involves multiple actions, but the first step is to navigate to the shopping cart so that it can be emptied. The shopping cart icon is visible on the top right corner of the current webpage. Clicking on the cart icon will take us to the page where we can view and manage the items in the cart.
action_plan: Click on the shopping cart icon to view the cart contents.
Empty the shopping cart by removing any items if present.
After the cart is empty, navigate back to the Best Buy homepage or use the search bar to search for 'macbook air'.
Select the first entry of 'macbook air' from the search results.
Add the selected 'macbook air' to the shopping cart.
action_desc: Click on the shopping cart icon located in the top right corner.
action_result:
By clicking on the shopping cart icon located at the upper right, I have navigated to the shopping cart page of Best Buy's website. The consequence of this action is evident in the current screenshot, which shows that the cart is currently empty ("Your cart is empty"). This has made progress towards the user request in terms of confirming that the shopping cart is empty, which was the first part of the user's request.

However, to fully complete the user's request, the next steps would involve searching for "macbook air" on the Best Buy website, selecting the first entry in the search results, and then adding that item to the shopping cart. As the cart is verified to be empty, I can now proceed with the second part of the user's request; to begin this part, I should navigate back to the main page or use the search bar at the top of the page to search for "macbook air."
